profile.name: Brendan Copley
profile.aboutMe: DevOps-Focused Engineering Leader with over 10 years of experience in software development, data automation, and cloud infrastructure projects. Skilled in Python, SQL, and JavaScript with deep expertise in AWS and CI/CD pipelines. Proven track record of leading high-performing engineering teams, implementing DataOps best practices, and architecting scalable solutions that drive business objectives. Passionate about mentoring junior developers, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and continuously improving development processes through automation and innovation.

experience.description: Created AI-driven lesson ingestion pipeline using Google Vertex AI and integrated with OpenAI to transform teacher's lessons into interactive activities. Developed Python utilities for ML fine-tuning processes, fixing the openai/evals repo to work with thinking models. Led a cross-functional team implementing standards for a 700k+ LOC monolith. Worked on microservice-based AI Agent SDK using JavaScript/TypeScript (NestJS). Created GitLab CI/CD automation workflows and developed a Python-based MCP Server for promptcrafting adopted by 30+ engineers.

Architected Python backend server for a Fallout TV series companion game, collaborating with Amazon Prime Video & Bethesda. Implemented e-commerce digital asset management system for Carparts.com deployed with Jenkins on AWS EKS with Python microservices and Apache Kafka, achieving 500% increase in message processing. Developed Python automation scripts for data processing with AWS Snowflake. Created Python backend service for Arsonal.com with Algolia and Vertex AI visual search. Implemented data processing pipelines for multiple e-commerce platforms.

Owned technical roadmap for order and shipping systems, implementing AWS Lambda + API Gateway solution with 250% performance improvement. Led cross-functional meetings aligning development with business needs. Mentored junior engineers and established code review processes. Implemented Redis caching strategies and Python automation scripts. Migrated frontend to AWS S3/CloudFront and created CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions. Developed a Vue.js SPA and React-Native app with AWS integrations. Created comprehensive documentation for SOC 2 readiness.

Provided technical leadership to junior developers through mentoring and code reviews. Integrated Utelogy's software on Microsoft's campus for Azure security team, enabling control of 100+ monitors as a video wall. Led architecture of U-Control 2.0, a C# and .NET-based MVC for AV/IoT device control. Deployed component-based frontend on Azure App Services, achieving 600% adoption increase across 300+ schools in Southern California. Optimized SQL queries and implemented comprehensive testing strategies for device integration.

project.name: OpenAI Evals for Thinking Models
project.description: Modified and extended OpenAI's evaluation framework to support 'thinking models' like o3-mini that expose their reasoning process. The original framework was incompatible with these newer models that include thinking/reasoning steps in their output. Implemented specialized parsing logic and evaluation metrics that properly handle and assess multi-step reasoning patterns, making the framework usable for modern AI research and development with reflective reasoning capabilities.

project.name: MCP Chain of Draft Prompt Tool
project.description: Developed an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool that enhances LLM reasoning by implementing the Chain of Draft approach. The tool transforms standard prompts into CoD format, significantly improving reasoning quality while reducing token usage by up to 92.4%. Features include BYOLLM support for various models (Claude, GPT, Ollama, local models), performance analytics, adaptive word limits, and comprehensive example databases.

project.name: MCP Tool-Use with Ollama
project.description: Developed and published a comprehensive guide on implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with open-source AI models. Created a system that integrates Ollama, Dive, and custom fetch tools to enable local AI agents to interact with web content. This privacy-focused solution keeps all data on the local machine while enabling powerful tool use capabilities for open-source models, eliminating dependency on external API services.

project.name: Fallout TV Series Companion Game
project.description: Architected the Python backend server for a companion game for Amazon Prime Video's Fallout TV series featured at CCXP (Comic Con Experience). Developed in collaboration with Amazon Prime Video and Bethesda Game Studios, this interactive experience extended the Fallout universe for fans attending the event. Collaborated with Jeremy Walker to create the frontend of the game.

project.name: Content Moderation Vulgarity Filter
project.description: Fine-tuned Qwen2.5 to create a specialized content moderation model that accurately identifies and filters inappropriate content. The model evaluates text for vulgarity, profanity, and harmful content while maintaining context awareness to reduce false positives. Optimized for efficiency and low latency, making it suitable for real-time content moderation in applications, chatbots, and social platforms without requiring cloud-based moderation services.

project.name: Speech-to-SQL Fine-tuned LLM
project.description: Fine-tuned Qwen2.5-14B to create a specialized model that converts natural language queries into SQL statements. This custom model bridges the gap between conversational speech and database queries, enabling non-technical users to interact with databases using natural language. Optimized for MLX runtime on Apple Silicon, making it efficient for local deployment without requiring cloud API services.
